hackathon-description-text: GrizzHacks is the innaugural hackathon at Oakland University in Rochester, Michigan.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Software Engineer at Hello World

hackathon-eligibility: Any current student or person who has graduated within the last calendar year.
hackathon-rules: GrizzHacks rules are simple: Don't start your hack before the event, and have fun! Participants must also follow the MLH Code of Conduct: http://mlh.io/code-of-conduct

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue Tablets for each team member, and each team member has their choice of: Raspberry Pi 3 Canakit, Seagate 1 TB Portable Hard Drive, Hubsan X4 Quadcopter with HD camera, or $100 Treehouse credits.
Each team member has their choice of: Raspberry Pi 3 Canakit, Seagate 1 TB Portable Hard Drive, Hubsan X4 Quadcopter with HD camera, or $100 Treehouse credits.
Each team member has their choice of: Raspberry Pi 3 Canakit, Seagate 1 TB Portable Hard Drive, Hubsan X4 Quadcopter with HD camera, or $100 Treehouse credits.

hackathon-description-header: GrizzHacks is the first ever hackathon at Oakland University.
